text: <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated translocation of nuclear factor-kappa B induced by lipopolysaccharide does not require tyrosine kinase activity .

During the course of serious bacterial infections , lipopolysaccharide ( LPS ) is believed to interact with macrophage receptors , resulting in the generation of inflammatory mediators and systemic symptoms including hemodynamic instability and shock .
<extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a glycosylphosphatidylinositol - linked antigen , functions as an LPS signaling receptor .
A critical issue concerns the mechanism by which <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , which has no transmembrane domain , transduces its signal following LPS binding .

Recently , investigators have hypothesized that <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated signaling is effected through a receptor - associated tyrosine kinase ( TK ) , suggesting a multicomponent receptor model of LPS signaling .

Wild-type Chinese hamster ovary ( CHO ) - K1 cells can be activated by endotoxin to release arachidonate following transfection with human <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( CHO / <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .

text: Nuclear translocation of cytosolic NF-kappa B is correlated with a number of LPS - inducible responses .

We sought to determine if this pathway were present in CHO / <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cells and to elucidate the relationship of NF-kappa B activation to the <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> receptor system .
LPS - stimulated translocation of NF-kappa B in CHO / <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cells resembled the same response in the murine macrophage-like cell line RAW 264.7 .

Protein synthesis inhibitors and corticosteroids , which suppress arachidonate release and the synthesis of proinflammatory cytokines , had no effect on translocation of NF-kappa B in CHO / <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or RAW 264.7 cells , demonstrating that NF-kappa B translocation is an early event .

Although TK activity was consistently observed by immunoblotting extracts from activated RAW 264.7 cells , LPS - induced phosphotyrosine residues were not observed from similarly treated CHO / <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cells .

Furthermore , the TK inhibitors herbimycin A and genistein failed to inhibit translocation of NF-kappa B in CHO / <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or RAW 264.7 cells , although both of these agents inhibited LPS - induced TK activity in RAW 264.7 cells .
These results imply that TK activity is not obligatory for <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated signal transduction to occur in response to LPS .
